channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: President Halimah pays virtual visit to nursing home
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Since Monday, Ms Tijam Stephanie May Gonzales has had to stay in a hotel as a precautionary step.

item.title: A city at a standstill
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In a city that has hit the pause button, it is the security officer you see the most often.

item.title: CCA instructors can opt to get paid early, extend contracts
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Instructors and coaches who have had their income disrupted by the suspension of co-curricular activities (CCAs) can opt to get paid ahead of work done, as schools look at alternative ways to hold such classes amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: G-20 trade ministers seek to keep trade, transport flowing
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Trade ministers from the world's largest economies yesterday pledged to ensure that emergency measures to tackle Covid-19 - such as export restrictions on medical supplies and essential goods - are targeted, transparent and temporary.

item.title: Up to $25k funding to co-produce engaging video content with SPH
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Local media and production companies could receive funding of up to $25,000 if they answer a call by Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) to co-produce engaging video content for its audience.

item.title: Some house hunters buying homes after virtual viewings
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In August, Mr Fawzi Jaafar will step into the three-room Housing Board resale flat in Ang Mo Kio, which he bought last month, for the first time.

item.title: All staff at pre-schools to undergo swab tests for virus
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

All pre-school staff will undergo a one-time swab test for Covid-19 starting today, before the centres reopen. The test, which is a precautionary measure, will cover principals, teachers and the carers who look after infants and toddlers.

item.title: Firms commit to donations of fresh veggies, shoes for healthcare staff
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Healthcare workers at the front line of the fight against Covid-19 have been receiving donations of face masks, cooked food and other care packages in acknowledgement of their efforts.

item.title: Family violence up amid circuit breaker
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Family violence has been on the rise since the circuit breaker kicked in on April 7, according to latest police figures, and this has prompted the authorities to take a more proactive approach to help high-risk victims.

item.title: Proposals to amend data protection law include stiffer fines
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In case of a data breach, organisations may soon be slapped with fines of up to 10 per cent of their annual gross turnover or $1 million, whichever is higher, if proposed amendments to the Personal Data Protection Act go through.

item.title: 43 coronavirus tests authorised for use here in past three months
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 40 different coronavirus tests have been authorised for use in Singapore over the past three months as the Health Sciences Authority (HSA) expedites its approval process to meet demand.

item.title: Trio charged over alleged links to Chinatown riot
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Three men appeared in a district court yesterday over their alleged involvement in a riot at a Chinatown apartment block on Sunday.

item.title: Two new community coronavirus cases, lowest figure since April 7; 1,164 discharged
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of patients discharged in a day crossed the 1,000 mark for the first time yesterday, and the number of cases in the community hit a low as the Covid-19 situation here continued to show signs of stabilising.

item.title: Wilmar, its chairman giving $7m to ST pocket money fund
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Agribusiness group Wilmar International and its chairman and chief executive Kuok Khoon Hong will be donating a total of $7 million to The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund (STSPMF) over the next three years.

item.title: Recovery facilities coming up at Turf Club can house 3,600 workers
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The community recovery facilities (CRFs) at the Singapore Turf Club will be able to house 3,600 Covid-19 patients when they are completed by the end of the month.

item.title: 'More authentic, personal' with Yale-NUS online graduation
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Scott Lee Chua was all set to deliver a speech on stage on behalf of the Class of 2020 at their Yale-NUS College graduation ceremony this month.

item.title: Chef keeps busy with temp job as supermarket worker
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In normal times, Mr Alex Yeo whips up tantalising dishes at Michelin-starred Cantonese restaurant Jiang-Nan Chun.

item.title: Partitions in lorry to ensure workers' safe distancing 'not secure'
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A firm's plan to have physical partitions in the back of a lorry to ensure safe distancing for workers has been given a no-go by the authorities, as a video of the vehicle made the rounds online. The authorities said the set-up was not secure and asked the firm to review its plan.

item.title: Hospitals may resume elective procedures in gradual manner
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Many elective procedures in hospitals have been put on hold since February to free up capacity for Covid-19 patients as the pandemic rages on. It is the same scenario in many parts of the world.

item.title: Killer spared the gallows as factors weighed in his favour: Judge
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In 2016, a rag-and-bone man knifed a coffee shop helper to death while they were fighting.

item.title: Surgery postponed for some, but necessary procedures still done
item.description:
May 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Mrs Maria Lim was due to see her doctor this month - a follow-up for her knee replacement surgery done a year ago and her osteoporosis condition - but the appointment has been postponed to July.
